result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ted J Augustine

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Ted J Augustine in court.  Attorney Kathleen A Kruse in court for Ted J Augustine.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kruse provides an update; she has discovery and is in discussions with the ADA assigned.  Atty. Kruse requests one more further proceedings in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:07 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ted J Augustine in court.  Attorney Kathleen A Kruse in court for Ted J Augustine. Atty. Kruse provides an update; she has an offer but only some of the discovery, she is waiting on digital discovery.  Atty. Kruse requests another further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B l(EXCEPTION: incidental contact is allowed as they live in the same complex) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

8:26 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Ted J Augustine in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser for attorney Kathleen Kruse in court for Ted J Augustine.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul Reilly on 8/11/22
